decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's plays with counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Negation, removal spells like Fatal Push, and hand disruption with Thoughtseize. The deck also focuses on graveyard synergies with cards like Cling to Dust and Unearth. The win conditions include big flying threats like Murktide Regent and Harbinger of the Seas, as well as card advantage engines like Meticulous Archive. The mana base is designed to support the dual-colored nature of the deck, with lands like Polluted Delta and Watery Grave.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using cards like Amulet of Vigor, Arboreal Grazer, and Azusa, Lost but Seeking to cast Primeval Titan as soon as possible. The key strategy is to use Primeval Titan's ability to search for specific lands like The Mycosynth Gardens and Lotus Field to generate even more mana, allowing for explosive plays such as casting Scapeshift to search for multiple lands and win the game in one turn. The deck also includes utility lands like Vesuva and Mirrorpool to further enhance its combo potential.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly to ramp into powerful threats like Primeval Titan and utilize land-based combo strategies like Scapeshift. It includes cards like Amulet of Vigor to speed up the process and ensure smooth mana development. With efficient land bounce effects and utility lands like Urza's Saga, the deck can quickly assemble powerful combinations to overwhelm opponents. It also includes cards like Summoner's Pact to search for key creatures and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect key spells from countermagic. Overall, the deck aims to utilize land synergies and fast mana generation to establish dominance in the mid to late game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays to overwhelm opponents. Utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. With a mix of burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and creature buffs like Ocelot Pride, this deck can quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional power and resilience to help secure a swift victory. Keeping the opponent on the back foot is key to this deck's success.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of strong creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Guide of Souls, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory to provide support and buff the creatures. The focus is on being aggressive and putting pressure on the opponent in order to quickly end the game. Additionally, cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm offer disruption and protection for your creatures.

The deck focuses on using ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes control elements such as Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining ramp and control elements, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive Eldrazi threats while keeping the opponent's board in check. The inclusion of cards like Devourer of Destiny and Sire of Seven Deaths provide additional ways to close out the game or gain advantage over the opponent.

This deck utilizes instant reanimation and card manipulation to quickly bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emperor of Bones back from the graveyard for a quick win. By discarding cards like Faithless Looting and using spells like Goryo's Vengeance, the deck can set up devastating combos and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures. The inclusion of counterspells like Force of Negation and hand disruption like Thoughtseize helps protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can react.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to control the game's pace and limit the opponent's options. The inclusion of cards like Isochron Scepter and Orim's Chant provides additional ways to disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck aims to outlast the opponent by maintaining a strong defense and gradually gaining an advantage through efficient card draw and removal spells.

This deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures and using spells to control the board. It aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, along with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial. The deck also benefits from Leyline of the Guildpact to pump up its creatures and increase damage output. The inclusion of Tribal Flames provides additional reach to finish off the opponent. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the casting of all spells and creatures efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by removing opponent's threats and disrupting their strategy by using cards like Skyclave Apparition, Solitude, Path to Exile, and Wrath of the Skies. It also aims to maintain board presence with White Orchid Phantom and protect key pieces with cards like Reprieve and Ephemerate. Crucible of Worlds and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional utility and recursion options. The deck utilizes land destruction with Ghost Quarter, Field of Ruin, and Demolition Field to disrupt opponent's mana base. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win.

The deck focuses on putting creatures into the graveyard and then using Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once, overwhelming the opponent with a powerful board presence. Cards like Ardent Plea and Shardless Agent help cycle through the deck to find the combo pieces needed, while Endurance and Street Wraith provide graveyard manipulation and card draw. Force of Negation and Subtlety offer protection and control against opposing plays, ensuring that the combo can go off successfully. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo and win the game in a burst of explosive power.

This deck focuses on overwhelming opponents with aggressive Eldrazi creatures, utilizing cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths to disrupt their strategy. It also includes powerful finishers like It That Heralds the End and All Is Dust to close out games quickly. The mana base is optimized for casting Eldrazi creatures efficiently, with cards like Unclaimed Territory and Eldrazi Temple providing mana acceleration. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent, forcing them to react quickly or risk being overrun by the Eldrazi onslaught.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures along with disruptive cards to control the opponent's board. By using cards like Thoughtseize to strip the opponent's hand and cards like Solitude to remove threats, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The deck also utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to generate extra value from enter-the-battlefield effects on creatures. Overall, the deck combines aggro strategies with disruptive elements to create a versatile and challenging opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus. It utilizes powerful creatures like Solitude and Overlord of the Balemurk to apply pressure and control the board. The deck also includes flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to generate additional value from enters-the-battlefield abilities. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of aggro and control elements.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling and executing a powerful combo without relying on lands. By utilizing a combination of countermagic, card draw, and tutoring effects, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition with cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect. The key strategy is to efficiently control the game until the combo pieces are in place, then unleash a devastating finisher like Goblin Charbelcher to secure victory in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on using powerful creatures like Scion of Draco, Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, and Sazh's Chocobo to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to control the board while Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial provide removal and protection. The deck also utilizes efficient land fetching with cards like Arid Mesa and Wooded Foothills to ensure smooth mana curve. By maintaining pressure and board presence, this Aggro deck aims to swiftly defeat the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.
